channel.title: BBC News - Europe

item.title: Russian gay family flees to Spain after threats
item.description: The lesbian family suffered homophobic abuse after appearing in a Russian health food ad.

item.title: Turkish influencer prosecuted 'for photos at Amsterdam sex museum'
item.description: Merve Taskin says she faces obscenity charges in Turkey after posting "joke" photos of sex toys.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Shanne Braspennincx wins keirin gold six years on from heart attack
item.description: Dutch rider Shanne Braspennincx wins Olympic gold in the keirin, six years after suffering a heart attack.

item.title: Migrant crossings: Record 482 cross English Channel in one day
item.description: According to Home Office figures, there have now been 10,236 arrivals in 434 boats so far in 2021.

item.title: Covid travel: France moves to amber list and green list expands
item.description: Up to 6,000 Britons are currently in Mexico, which is moving to the red list, Grant Shapps says.

item.title: Belarus sprinter Krystina Timanovskaya arrives in Poland
item.description: Krystina Timanovskaya was granted a humanitarian visa after she refused orders to fly home early.

item.title: Greece wildfires force people to flee island by boat
item.description: Scores of people on Evia were forced to evacuate by sea as wildfire spread rapidly, destroying homes.

item.title: Scotland's colourful marine life
item.description: Scuba-diver Ross McLaren has taken thousands of photos of marine life in Scotland's rivers and sea-lochs.

item.title: 'Old dogs' take on teens in skateboarding
item.description: Not everyone skateboarding at the Olympics is a teenager - meet the two 46-year-olds who flew the flag for the "old dogs".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics sparks anti-LGBT slurs on Russian TV
item.description: Gay and transgender athletes in Tokyo have been singled out for abuse on Russian state television.

item.title: Vitaly Shishov: Belarus dissidents who disappeared and died
item.description: For years opponents of Belarus leader Alexander Lukashenko have been hounded - sometimes fatally.

item.title: Amber-plus list: Why were extra travel restrictions imposed on France?
item.description: France has now been taken off the amber-plus list but why was it put on it in the first place?

item.title: Sport climbing makes its Olympic debut - here's all you need to know
item.description: Climbing is the last of the new Olympic sports to make its appearance at Tokyo 2020. Here's a guide to the things you need to know.

item.title: Belarus Olympian Timanovskaya: 'When it's safe, I want to return home'
item.description: A sprinter from Belarus who refused her team's order to fly home early from the Olympics says her actions were not a form of political protest.

item.title: Christian Eriksen referee: Defibrillators save lives
item.description: Premier League referee Anthony Taylor outlines why defibrillators should be available for grassroots football.

item.title: Turkey: People flee popular tourist spots to escape wildfires
item.description: Footage has emerged showing people fleeing the deadly fires which have engulfed parts of Turkey.

item.title: Turkey wildfires: People flee as blazes spread in Marmaris and Bodrum
item.description: Some neighbourhoods have been evacuated after gusts of wind spread the flames into residential areas.

item.title: Roma student: 'My only goal is to finish school'
item.description: How one school in Croatia is working to improve education opportunities for Roma children like Kristina.
